summary: REQ-6 is partially implemented: the reveal view’s source was changed to point to the uploaded WhatsApp image path and the reveal message text appears unchanged. However, the diff does not show the uploaded image being added to the frontend’s static assets, so it’s not verifiable that the image will actually load as a static asset at runtime.

missing_requirements.requirement: The uploaded image ("WhatsApp Image 2026-02-07 at 8.14.44 PM.jpeg") is stored as a static frontend asset and loaded directly by the frontend (no backend calls).
missing_requirements.reason: The code now references the image at "/assets/WhatsApp Image 2026-02-07 at 8.14.44 PM.jpeg", but the diff shows no new/added asset file under the frontend public/static assets. Without the asset being present in the repo, the frontend will 404 the image.
evidence: frontend/src/App.tsx (img src updated, but no asset file added per diff: "Added: 0")
